title: ZOROOOX High-Performance 3-Star Table Tennis Balls - Pack of | 9, 18, 36 or 72 | Orange or White | 40+ ABS Competition Grade Ping Pong Balls
features: TOURNAMENT QUALITY: These 3-star ABS balls provide competition-level performance for serious players, approved for league and tournament play.
VIBRANT COLOURS: Available in packs of 9 or 18 balls, the bright white and orange colour scheme makes the ball easy to track during fast-paced rallies.
DURABLE CONSTRUCTION: Made from robust ABS plastic with a textured surface, Zorooox balls maintain roundness and bounce through countless games.
EXCELLENT CONTROL: The balls have a smooth surface and a balanced weight distribution, allowing for precise control and accurate shots.
OFFICIAL STANDARD: Meeting ITTF 3-star specifications, players can rely on consistent quality control from ball to ball.
PREMIUM SERVICE: ZOROOOX offers a 1-year warranty and excellent customer service. If you have any questions or concerns about the product, please feel free to contact us.

So why settle for subpar table tennis balls when you can upgrade to ZOROOX Table Tennis Balls? Time to take your game to the next level! Precautions and Reuse: Clean balls with a wet and clean cloth. Use dry cloth to dry them avoid air drying. Don’t store in direct sunlight Don’t store in a high moisture room (e.g. bathroom) Don’t expose to excessive heat Don’t leave them on the floor so people don’t over step on them! What are the differences between 1-star, 2-star, and 3-star table tennis balls? Answer : The star rating indicates the quality and durability of the balls. 1-star balls are typically used for casual play, 2-star balls for training, and 3-star balls for professional and competitive play, offering the best performance and consistency. What is the standard size and weight of a table tennis ball? Answer : The standard size of a table tennis ball is 40mm in diameter, and it weighs approximately 2.7 grams. What materials are table tennis balls made from? Answer : Modern table tennis balls are made from a polymer called ABS, which provides better durability and bounce consistency compared to the older celluloid balls. What color options are available for table tennis balls, and do they affect play? Answer : Table tennis balls are commonly available in white and orange. The color does not affect play, but the choice can depend on the table surface and lighting conditions for better visibility. How long do table tennis balls typically last? Answer : The lifespan of a table tennis ball depends on the frequency and intensity of use. High-quality 3-star balls can last several matches, while 1-star balls might be more prone to damage with regular use. How should I store my table tennis balls to ensure longevity? Answer : Store your table tennis balls in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and extreme temperatures to prevent them from warping or becoming brittle Can table tennis balls be cleaned? Answer : Yes, you can clean table tennis balls by gently wiping them with a damp cloth. Avoid using harsh chemicals or submerging them in water. Are there different types of table tennis balls for indoor and outdoor use? Answer : While most table tennis balls are designed for indoor use, there are specific outdoor balls that are more durable and weather-resistant. How can I tell if a table tennis ball is damaged? Answer : Check for cracks, dents, or loss of shape. A damaged ball will have inconsistent bounce and may produce a different sound when hit. Do table tennis balls come in different sizes for different skill levels or age groups? Answer : Standard table tennis balls are 40mm in diameter and used universally across all skill levels and age groups.
